etymology.description: 凤梨/鳳梨 (pineapple) + 酥 (flaky pastry) = pineapple pastry/cake
etymology.interpretation: Names a pastry with pineapple filling and a crisp, crumbly shell. Emphasizes both the fruit flavor (凤梨) and the flaky texture (酥), widely associated with Taiwan.
etymology.simplification: 鳳 was simplified to 凤 by streamlining the 鳥 component to reduce strokes; 梨 and 酥 are unchanged. Taiwan commonly writes 鳳梨酥 in traditional characters.

parts.english: phoenix; auspicious; elegant; used in names
pear; pear tree; pear fruit; surname

examples.chinese: 我最喜欢台湾的凤梨酥(我最喜歡臺灣的鳳梨酥)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuan Táiwān de fènglísū.
examples.english: I like Taiwan’s pineapple cakes the most.

examples.chinese: 这家店的凤梨酥外皮很酥，内馅是纯凤梨(這家店的鳳梨酥外皮很酥，內餡是純鳳梨)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn de fènglísū wàipí hěn sū, nèixiàn shì chún fènglí.
examples.english: The pineapple cake here has a very flaky crust, and the filling is pure pineapple.

examples.chinese: 过年时我常买凤梨酥送朋友当伴手礼(過年時我常買鳳梨酥送朋友當伴手禮)。
examples.pinyin: Guònián shí wǒ cháng mǎi fènglísū sòng péngyou dāng bànshǒulǐ.
examples.english: During the New Year I often buy pineapple cakes as gifts for friends.
